record.title: ORDER OF PROCEDURE

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I have been on the road and I telephoned in and asked the cloakroom to reserve the period of 3:45 to 4:30 for the Senator from Virginia and seven other Senators to speak briefly. I ask unanimous consent that my request be granted.

record.chair: Is there objection? Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, may I speak as if in morning business?

record.chair: We are in morning business, and the Senator may speak for up to 10 minutes.
That is the order we are under.
